required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Monitoring of Prostate Position During Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Feasibility Study of Prostate Cancer Radiotherapy Gating Using kV Intrafraction Monitoring (KIM)

oversight_info.authority: Australia: National Health and Medical Research Council

brief_summary.textblock: This study is investigating measurement of prostate motion during radiotherapy using the implanted gold markers. If motion is greater than 3mm then the beam will be stopped and position corrected (gating).

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Technique will be determined as feasible if 90% of treatment fractions are successfully segmented in real time.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of time taken to perform KIM gating to guide future department resource questions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Radiotherapy gating using kV intrafraction monitoring

intervention.intervention_name: Prostate cancer radiotherapy gating using kV intrafraction monitoring (KIM)
intervention.arm_group_label: Radiotherapy gating using kV intrafraction monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing definitive external beam radiotherapy;
- Histological proven prostate adenocarcinoma
- Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA),within 3 months prior to enrolment
- Patient must be able to have gold fiducial markers placed in the prostate (if on anticoagulants, must be approved for procedure by Cardiologist)
- ECOG 0-2
- Ability to understand and willingness to sign informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lymph node irradiation
- Altered fractionation
- Artificial hip(s)
- Patient Dimensions <50cm
- Overlapping fiducials (for segmentation)

facility.name: Department of Radiation Oncology, Northern Sydney Cancer Centre

investigator.last_name: Thomas N Eade, RANZCR I & II
